item.title: Mumbai Techie, 31, Dies Of Heart Attack While Playing Cricket - NDTV
item.description:
Mumbai Techie, 31, Dies Of Heart Attack While Playing Cricket

Publication Date: Recent News

Source: NDTV

A 31-year-old software engineer, Vikram Ashok Deshmukh, tragically passed away due to a heart attack while playing cricket in Mumbai.

  • Deshmukh was playing a 25-over practice match at Azad Maidan.
  • He complained of chest pain in the 10th over but continued playing.
  • He collapsed after taking a run in the 17th over and was later pronounced dead in the hospital.
  • He is survived by his wife, parents, and a one-year-old son.
  • The police have filed an Accidental Death Report and initiated an investigation.
“He collapsed during the game and could not be revived,” said a witness.

This unfortunate incident highlights the unpredictability of health emergencies, even during seemingly regular activities like sports.

item.title: Virat Kohli Goes Through Many Emotions As India Avoid Follow-On In 3rd Australia Test - Video Is Vir.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Virat Kohli Goes Through Many Emotions As India Avoid Follow-On In 3rd Australia Test - Video Is Viral

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: NDTV

This article covers India's tense final session on Day 4 of the third Test against Australia, where a critical 10th-wicket partnership helped India avoid a follow-on, highlighting Kohli's emotional response to the moment.

  • Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep formed a resilient 10th-wicket partnership to thwart Australia.
  • The partnership ensured India did not have to bat again immediately, with the match heading towards a draw.
  • Virat Kohli displayed a range of emotions captured in a viral video during the match.
  • KL Rahul praised the effort of the lower-order batsmen, emphasizing its importance in the match.
  • The five-match series is currently tied at 1-1.
“To avoid that follow-on makes a huge difference.” - KL Rahul

India displayed great resilience, showcasing their determination in a match that will likely influence the rest of the series.

item.title: India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 4 Highlights: IND 252/9 vs AUS at stumps in Brisbane - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 4 Highlights: IND 252/9 vs AUS at stumps in Brisbane

Date: Tuesday, Publication: Indian Express

After Day 4 of the third Test at Gabba, India scored 252/9, avoiding follow-on against Australia. KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja made significant contributions to keep the match competitive.

  • India trails by 193 runs but has crossed the 246 run mark, preventing Australia from enforcing a follow-on.
  • Josh Hazlewood is out of the Test due to injury.
  • The series stands at 1-1 after India won the first Test and Australia claimed victory in Adelaide.
“Raining Indian wickets at Gabba” - A difficult day for Indian batters.

The match remains open for a draw as India seeks to recover in the ongoing series.

item.title: 'He's done it for so many years': KL Rahul shows what India miss without Ravindra Jadeja in their Playing XI - Hindustan Times
item.description:
KL Rahul Highlights Importance of Ravindra Jadeja in India's XI

Date: Dec 17, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent cricket match, KL Rahul praised Ravindra Jadeja for his impressive batting performance that played a crucial role in India's innings during the Brisbane Test against Australia.

  • Jadeja scored 77 runs off 123 balls, helping stabilize the innings after early wickets.
  • Rahul and Jadeja shared a vital 67-run stand for the sixth wicket.
  • Jadeja's contribution helped India avoid follow-on and set a competitive score.
“Jadeja was brilliant today. He has been brilliant batting down the order for us for many, many years,” said Rahul.

Rahul emphasized that Jadeja’s consistent performance is key to India’s success, highlighting how he often delivers under pressure with not only his bowling but also his batting skills.

item.title: Rain To Ruin Action-Packed Day 5 Of India vs Australia 3rd Test In Brisbane? Report Says... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rain To Ruin Action-Packed Day 5 Of India vs Australia 3rd Test In Brisbane? Report Says...

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: ESPNcricinfo

The third Test match between India and Australia at the Gabba is under threat from rain, with a high chance of showers expected on the final day of the match. India has put up a strong fight, but the weather may impact their chances of making a comeback.

  • Australia's Bureau of Meteorology forecasts high chances of rain and possible severe thunderstorms on the last day.
  • India ended day four at 252/9, trailing by 193 runs, after notable performances from KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja.
  • KL Rahul expressed frustration over the interruptions due to the rain.
  • With the series tied at 1-1, this match's outcome is crucial.
“I think I got more tired running up and down from the dressing room than I did being in the middle.” - KL Rahul

With rain looming, both teams face a challenging end to the match which could shift the momentum at a critical point in the series.

item.title: Watch: Virat Kohli Stunned, Gautam Gambhir Delighted As Akash Deep Hits Pat Cummins For Mammoth Six - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Virat Kohli Stunned, Gautam Gambhir Delighted As Akash Deep Hits Pat Cummins For Mammoth Six

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

In an exhilarating moment during the third Test between India and Australia, Akash Deep hit a massive six off Pat Cummins, leaving Virat Kohli stunned and Gautam Gambhir delighted. This moment followed a pivotal partnership that helped India avoid a follow-on.

  • Akash Deep hit a six over deep mid-wicket against Cummins.
  • The Indian dressing room celebrated avoiding follow-on after Deep's explosive hit.
  • Jadeja and Rahul contributed significantly with their fighting fifties.
  • The match is significantly affected by inclement weather and is leaning towards a draw.
"Rohit, Gambhir and Kohli's reaction on Akash deep six against Pat Cummins" — Kuljot (@Kuljot__)

India's batting performance showcased resilience despite challenging conditions, with a close call caused by weather disruptions.

item.title: Australian team to offer 'care and love,' Nathan Lyon remarks, as Josh Hazlewood is expected to miss rest - The Times of India
item.description:
Australian team to offer 'care and love,' Nathan Lyon remarks, as Josh Hazlewood is expected to miss rest of series

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Time of India

Josh Hazlewood is likely to be absent for the remaining Border-Gavaskar Trophy matches due to a right calf strain sustained during the third Test.

  • Hazlewood's injury occurred at the Gabba, impacting Australia's bowling strength.
  • Nathan Lyon expressed concern, stating the team will support Hazlewood emotionally.
  • Cricket Australia confirmed Hazlewood's unavailability for the remainder of the series.
  • Assistant coach Daniel Vettori described Hazlewood as despondent, highlighting the difficult timing of the injury.
  • Scott Boland is expected to return to the playing eleven to replace Hazlewood.
“He's pretty flat, But we'll get around him, put our arm around him and show a bit of care and love for the big fella.” - Nathan Lyon

The Australian team is rallying around Josh Hazlewood as he faces an extended period out due to injury, emphasizing the support and camaraderie within the squad.

item.title: Shaw left out of Mumbai squad for start of Vijay Hazare Trophy - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Prithvi Shaw Left Out of Mumbai Squad for Vijay Hazare Trophy

Date: Tue, Dec 17, 2024

Source: Cricbuzz

Prithvi Shaw has been omitted from the Mumbai squad announced for the first three matches of the Vijay Hazare Trophy, drawing attention due to his impressive performance record.

  • Shaw boasts an average of 55.72 from 65 List A matches and was integral to Mumbai's recent Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy victory.
  • His exclusion sparked an emotional response on social media, expressing his determination to return.
  • Captain Shreyas Iyer praised Shaw's talent but emphasized the need for improvement in work ethics.
  • The selectors have opted for 17-year-old Ayush Mhatre and other players for the opening spot.
  • Notable omissions from the squad include Rahane, Mohit Awasthi due to injury, and Shams Mulani.
"Tell me god, what more do I have to see... if 65 innings, 3399 runs at an average of 55.7 with a strike rate of 126, I'm not good enough..." - Prithvi Shaw

The Mumbai squad aims to kick off the Vijay Hazare Trophy without some experienced players, focusing on youth and potential.

item.title: Google Responds After Jasprit Bumrah Mentions Tech Giant To Shut Down Tricky Question In Australia - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Google Responds To Jasprit Bumrah's Witty Reply During Test Match Press Conference

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 - Source: NDTV Sports

After an amusing press conference, Jasprit Bumrah cleverly responded to a reporter's challenging question about India's batting performance against Australia, prompting a light-hearted response from Google India.

  • Bumrah was questioned about India's batting struggles after Day 3 of the Test match in Brisbane.
  • He humorously suggested the reporter check Google for batting statistics, highlighting his own record of 35 runs in an over.
  • Google India quoted Bumrah's comment in a social media post, stating, "I only believe in Jassi Bhai."
  • Bumrah leads the wicket tally in the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy with 18 wickets.

“I always look to solve it rather than complaining.” - Jasprit Bumrah

This exchange not only showcases Bumrah's wit but also highlights the connection between sports and digital platforms in today’s media landscape.

item.title: Prithvi Shaw dropped from Mumbai squad for Vijay Hazare Trophy - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Prithvi Shaw Dropped from Mumbai Squad for Vijay Hazare Trophy

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Prithvi Shaw has been dropped from the Mumbai squad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy amid concerns regarding his form and fitness.

  • Ajinkya Rahane, top scorer in the SMAT, has been rested at his request.
  • Shaw's performance has been under scrutiny after failing to score a half-century in nine innings.
  • Shaw surprised by his exclusion and expressed frustration on social media.
  • Shreyas Iyer emphasizes that players must maintain a strong work ethic.
“He needs to get his work ethics right, and if he does that, the sky is the limit for him,” - Shreyas Iyer

The Mumbai squad looks strong with key players returning, but Shaw's absence raises questions about his future in the team.

item.title: Sunil Gavaskar Fumes At Mohammed Siraj's 'Risky' Act, Questions His 'Cricketing Awareness' - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Fumes At Mohammed Siraj's 'Risky' Act, Questions His 'Cricketing Awareness'

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV

Legendary Indian cricket team skipper Sunil Gavaskar expressed his frustration towards Mohammed Siraj after a mix-up during a critical moment in the third Test against Australia.

  • Siraj walked in at No. 9 with India needing runs to avoid follow-on.
  • A mix-up occurred when Siraj took a risky single, prompting concern from Gavaskar.
  • Gavaskar questioned Siraj's cricketing awareness during such an important phase of the game.
  • India managed to avoid follow-on thanks to a solid 10th-wicket partnership between Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep.
  • The match is currently tied in the five-match series at 1-1.
"Look at that. There's got to be some cricketing awareness. You are a no.9 batter. You cannot think of taking risky singles," said Gavaskar.

This incident highlights the pressure of Test cricket and the need for strategic thinking in crucial moments.

item.title: 'What more do I have to see': Frustrated Mumbai batter Prithvi Shaw reacts after Vijay Hazare Trophy snub - The Times of India
item.description:
What more do I have to see: Frustrated Mumbai batter Prithvi Shaw reacts after Vijay Hazare Trophy snub

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Prithvi Shaw expressed his frustration regarding his exclusion from the Vijay Hazare Trophy squad, questioning what more he needs to do to be considered.

  • Shaw has been performing consistently but feels overlooked.
  • The snub has raised questions among fans and analysts about team selection criteria.
  • He conveyed his sentiments on social media, highlighting his dedication and hard work.
“What more do I have to see?”

The ongoing debates about team selection indicate a larger discussion about fairness and performance in cricket.

item.title: Conor McGregor inks preliminary deal with Ambani family for Logan Paul showdown in India - The Times of India
item.description:
Conor McGregor inks preliminary deal with Ambani family for Logan Paul showdown in India

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a major development, UFC star Conor McGregor has reached a preliminary agreement with the Ambani family to face Logan Paul in a high-profile match scheduled to take place in India.

  • The event is expected to attract significant media attention.
  • Details about the venue and date are yet to be finalized.
  • This collaboration reflects the growing popularity of mixed martial arts and boxing in India.
“This fight could be one of the biggest events in combat sports this year,” a source familiar with the negotiations stated.

This matchup promises to be a landmark event, not only for fans of McGregor and Paul but also for the sport's growing audience in India.

item.title: Virat Kohli’s bat works wonders for Akash Deep as India avert follow-on in Brisbane Test - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli’s bat works wonders for Akash Deep as India avert follow-on in Brisbane Test

Publication Date: Recent Publication - Source: Times of India

On day four of the Brisbane Test, India successfully avoided the follow-on, thanks to a determined last-wicket stand between Akash Deep and Jasprit Bumrah. This partnership significantly hampered Australia's chances of winning, especially after Josh Hazlewood's injury.

  • Akash Deep played aggressively to alleviate pressure during the final stages of the innings.
  • His edged boundary and a six off Cummins led to celebrations in the Indian camp.
  • At stumps, Deep was unbeaten on 27, with Bumrah on 10, forming a crucial 39-run partnership.
  • This performance has reduced India's chances of defeat, with Australia needing to take ten wickets.
  • Hazlewood's injury adds to Australia’s challenges in this Test match.
  • Deep received a heartfelt gift from Virat Kohli, who surprised him with a bat before the Test.
“Bat chaiye kya tujhe?” (Do you need a bat?) - Virat Kohli
“I will never play with that bat. It’s a huge gift from Virat bhaiya, and I will keep it as a souvenir.” - Akash Deep

This partnership of Akash Deep and Bumrah has greatly bolstered India's position in the match, making Australia's task of winning significantly harder.

item.title: Anil Kumble Breaks Silence On False 'Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma Disgraceful' Comments Attributed To H.. - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Rain likely to help India on final day in Brisbane - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Rain likely to help India on final day in Brisbane

Date: Unknown | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

India have positioned themselves to potentially draw the Gabba Test, thanks to a resilient last-wicket partnership. Rain is forecasted for the final day, affecting play and strategies.

  • India's last-wicket stand between Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep averts the follow-on.
  • Forecast predicts rain between 2mm and 25mm, likely leading to further interruptions.
  • Australia’s bowling strategy affected by Josh Hazlewood's calf injury.
  • KL Rahul acknowledges the challenge of frequent stoppages during play.
“I think I got most tired running up and down from the dressing room more than being in the middle.” - KL Rahul

The final day promises to be challenging for both teams, with weather conditions playing a crucial role.

item.title: Josh Hazlewood’s Test series likely over after suffering calf strain against India - The Guardian
item.description:
Josh Hazlewood's Test Series Likely Over Due to Calf Strain

Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: The Guardian

Australian fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has suffered a calf strain, likely ruling him out of the remainder of the Test series against India.

  • Hazlewood experienced discomfort during warm-ups and only bowled one over at the Gabba before being sidelined.
  • Medical scans confirmed a calf strain, leading to concerns about his availability for upcoming Tests in Melbourne and Sydney.
  • Cricket Australia is expected to announce a replacement squad member soon.
  • This injury adds to Hazlewood's recent struggles, including a previous side strain that prevented him from playing in Adelaide.
  • Scott Boland is the most likely candidate to replace Hazlewood if he cannot continue.
“He is likely to miss the remainder of the Test series.” - Cricket Australia

The potential absence of Hazlewood could significantly impact Australia’s bowling lineup, especially with upcoming matches against Sri Lanka and the West Indies on the horizon.

item.title: 'Dropped an absolute soda': Aussie commentators left shellshocked after Steve Smith drops a sitter. Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
Aussie Commentators Shocked as Steve Smith Drops Easy Catch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

On Day 4 at the Gabba, Steve Smith dropped a straightforward catch off Pat Cummins' first ball, allowing KL Rahul to capitalize and reach his 17th Test fifty.

  • KL Rahul was on 33 when Smith dropped the catch.
  • Brad Haddin commented on Smith's lapse in concentration.
  • Rahul eventually scored 84 runs before being dismissed by Smith, who made a remarkable catch to redeem himself.
  • Australia's field setup invited Rahul to play his preferred shots.
“That was a concentration lapse from Steve Smith, well bowled Pat Cummins. The ball could not have come slower or in a better position, but Steve Smith has dropped an absolute sitter.” - Brad Haddin

Despite the initial blunder, Smith's redemption came with a spectacular catch, highlighting the highs and lows of cricket.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir jumps out of seat as Akash Deep, Bumrah help India avoid follow-on, Virat Kohli's jaw drops 2 balls later - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir jumps out of seat as Akash Deep, Bumrah help India avoid follow-on, Virat Kohli's jaw drops 2 balls later

Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

India may not win this Test match, but they showcased great resilience on Day 4 against Australia, avoiding follow-on despite a precarious situation.

  • India started Day 4 with a score of 51/4 and faced the risk of follow-on.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep led a crucial partnership to surpass the follow-on mark.
  • India ended the day at 252/9, giving them a chance to save the match.
  • Ravindra Jadeja and KL Rahul's contributions were also vital earlier in the innings.
“With just three sessions left and rain expected, India are 99.9 percent going to Melbourne, still levelled with Australia at 1-1.”

The Indian team's determination has kept their hopes alive in the series, demonstrating their fighting spirit despite challenging circumstances.

item.title: Like Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, too, a master of his own demise - The Times of India
item.description:
Like Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, too, a master of his own demise

Date: BRISBANE, Australia

Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma faced his fourth consecutive failure on Australian soil, struggling against Pat Cummins. His lack of confidence is evident, reflecting on his underwhelming batting and leadership.

  • Rohit was dismissed during a critical Test match by Cummins, resulting in a mini celebration from the Australian team.
  • He exhibited poor technique, pushing at deliveries without proper footwork.
  • The Australian bowlers, including Cummins and Mitchell Starc, exploited his weaknesses effectively.
  • Rohit's batting performance has been disappointing, with just one half-century in his last 13 innings.
  • The pressure of past failures is impacting his current performance and captaincy.
“It was the epitome of a nothing shot.”

The ongoing struggles of Rohit Sharma may lead to further disappointment if he doesn't adjust his approach quickly.

item.title: India vs Australia, 3rd Test, Day 4 Highlights: Jasprit Bumrah, Akash Deep's Fightback Ends Australia's Follow-On Plan At Stumps - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Slams Pat Cummins For Massive Six. Australia Captain's Reaction Goes Viral - Watch - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Slams Pat Cummins For Massive Six. Australia Captain's Reaction Goes Viral - Watch

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 • Source: NDTV

Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah showcased his batting skills by hitting a massive six off Pat Cummins, leading to a viral reaction from the Australian captain during the ongoing Test match.

  • Bumrah hit a six in the 68th over of the Indian innings, stunning Cummins.
  • The six came from a back of the length delivery on the leg stump, showcasing Bumrah's batting talent.
  • India managed to avoid the follow-on, partnering Bumrah with Akash Deep effectively.
“Jasprit Bumrah just smashes Pat Cummins for six! #AUSvIND” — cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau)

The match was also notable for the injury of Australian bowler Josh Hazlewood, who is likely to miss the rest of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series due to a right calf strain.

Cricket Australia confirmed Hazlewood's injury via a statement, indicating a squad replacement will be arranged.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Jasprit Bumrah, Akash Deep's Fightback Ends Australia's Follow-On Plan At Stumps - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia, 3rd Test, Day 4 Highlights

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

The fourth day of the ongoing third Test between India and Australia showcased a remarkable performance by Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep, allowing India to avoid following on. At stumps, India scored 252/9, trailing by 193 runs.

  • India managed to avoid follow-on thanks to Bumrah and Deep's resilience.
  • KL Rahul scored 84 runs, while Ravindra Jadeja contributed 77 runs.
  • Pat Cummins took four wickets for Australia, with Mitchell Starc claiming three.
“AND THEY HAVE DONE IT!!!!! India have finally avoided the follow-on.”

The gripping contest on Day 4 ended with India poised to fight back further in the ongoing Test series, with their lower order showing impressive fight.

item.title: Give Amad the contract he deserves! Man Utd's 'chill guy' Diallo has ice in his veins and is quickly becoming Ruben Amorim's main man - now the club must lock down his future - Goal.com
item.description:
Give Amad the contract he deserves! Man Utd's 'chill guy' Diallo has ice in his veins and is quickly becoming Ruben Amorim's main man - now the club must lock down his future

Publication Date: Not specified Source: GOAL

The article discusses Amad Diallo's rise as Manchester United's best winger, highlighting his impressive performances and his importance to the team.

  • Amad Diallo has surpassed Marcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho as the club's top winger.
  • He played a crucial role in winning against Manchester City, reinforcing his cult-hero status.
  • Amad expressed his joy in contributing to the team's success and being a positive influence.
  • The club needs to secure Amad's future after a successful start to his career.
“I am so happy the team is very happy with me because I am a chill guy...But in the game you have to be focused and give your best.” - Amad Diallo

The call to action for Manchester United is clear: they must invest in Amad's future to ensure he continues to shine for the club.

item.title: From ‘next Tendulkar’ to unsold at IPL auction, Prithvi is looking for The Shaw Redemption - ThePrint
item.description:
The Struggles and Hopes of Prithvi Shaw: A Cricketing Tale

Publication Date: December 3, 2024 • Source: ThePrint

Prithvi Shaw, once hailed as the 'next Tendulkar', faces a challenging phase in his cricketing career. Despite earlier promise, controversies and lack of discipline have muddled his path to redemption. His friends and mentors believe he has the potential to make a comeback but emphasize the need for dedication.

  • Friends and mentors encourage Shaw's return despite a troubled past.
  • Critics highlight his indiscipline, fitness issues, and lack of commitment.
  • Shaw rose to fame young but now faces challenges akin to past cricketing stars.
  • His inconsistency in the national team raises concerns, with few international appearances.
  • Discipline and fitness have been significant barriers to his progression.
  • Former players and coaches express hope for Shaw to utilize available support to succeed.
“Some of the greatest sports stories are COMEBACK stories.”
— Kevin Pietersen

The narrative surrounding Shaw is one of promise interwoven with the need for personal discipline and focus. The cricketing world watches keenly as he navigates this critical juncture in his life.
